trans-unit.source: Enables collecting crash dump on expected as well as unexpected testhost exit.
trans-unit.target: Enables collecting crash dump on expected as well as unexpected testhost exit.

trans-unit.source:
Runs the tests in blame mode and collects a crash dump when the test host exits unexpectedly. This option depends on the version of .NET used, the type of error, and the operating system.
For exceptions in managed code, a dump will be automatically collected on .NET 5.0 and later versions. It will generate a dump for testhost or any child process that also ran on .NET 5.0 and crashed. Crashes in native code will not generate a dump. This option works on Windows, macOS, and Linux.
Crash dumps in native code, or when targetting .NET Framework, or .NET Core 3.1 and earlier versions, can only be collected on Windows, by using Procdump. A directory that contains procdump.exe and procdump64.exe must be in the PATH or PROCDUMP_PATH environment variable.
The tools can be downloaded here: https://docs.microsoft.com/sysinternals/downloads/procdump
To collect a crash dump from a native application running on .NET 5.0 or later, the usage of Procdump can be forced by setting the VSTEST_DUMP_FORCEPROCDUMP environment variable to 1.
Implies --blame.
trans-unit.target:
Runs the tests in blame mode and collects a crash dump when the test host exits unexpectedly. This option depends on the version of .NET used, the type of error, and the operating system.
For exceptions in managed code, a dump will be automatically collected on .NET 5.0 and later versions. It will generate a dump for testhost or any child process that also ran on .NET 5.0 and crashed. Crashes in native code will not generate a dump. This option works on Windows, macOS, and Linux.
Crash dumps in native code, or when targetting .NET Framework, or .NET Core 3.1 and earlier versions, can only be collected on Windows, by using Procdump. A directory that contains procdump.exe and procdump64.exe must be in the PATH or PROCDUMP_PATH environment variable.
The tools can be downloaded here: https://docs.microsoft.com/sysinternals/downloads/procdump
To collect a crash dump from a native application running on .NET 5.0 or later, the usage of Procdump can be forced by setting the VSTEST_DUMP_FORCEPROCDUMP environment variable to 1.
Implies --blame.

trans-unit.source: The type of crash dump to be collected. Supported values are full (default) and mini. Implies --blame-crash.
trans-unit.target: The type of crash dump to be collected. Supported values are full (default) and mini. Implies --blame-crash.

trans-unit.source:
Runs the tests in blame mode. This option is helpful in isolating problematic tests that cause the test host to crash or hang, but it does not create a memory dump by default.
When a crash is detected, it creates an sequence file in TestResults/guid/guid_Sequence.xml that captures the order of tests that were run before the crash.
Based on the additional settings, hang dump or crash dump can also be collected.
Example: Timeout the test run when test takes more than the default timeout of 1 hour, and collect crash dump when the test host exits unexpectedly. (Crash dumps require additional setup, see below.) dotnet test --blame-hang --blame-crash Example: Timeout the test run when a test takes more than 20 minutes and collect hang dump. dotnet test --blame-hang-timeout 20min
trans-unit.target:
Runs the tests in blame mode. This option is helpful in isolating problematic tests that cause the test host to crash or hang, but it does not create a memory dump by default.
When a crash is detected, it creates an sequence file in TestResults/guid/guid_Sequence.xml that captures the order of tests that were run before the crash.
Based on the additional settings, hang dump or crash dump can also be collected.
Example: Timeout the test run when test takes more than the default timeout of 1 hour, and collect crash dump when the test host exits unexpectedly. (Crash dumps require additional setup, see below.) dotnet test --blame-hang --blame-crash Example: Timeout the test run when a test takes more than 20 minutes and collect hang dump. dotnet test --blame-hang-timeout 20min

trans-unit.source: Run the tests in blame mode and enables collecting hang dump when test exceeds the given timeout.
trans-unit.target: Run the tests in blame mode and enables collecting hang dump when test exceeds the given timeout.

trans-unit.source: The type of crash dump to be collected. The supported values are full (default), mini, and none. When 'none' is used then test host is terminated on timeout, but no dump is collected. Implies --blame-hang.
trans-unit.target: The type of crash dump to be collected. The supported values are full (default), mini, and none. When 'none' is used then test host is terminated on timeout, but no dump is collected. Implies --blame-hang.

trans-unit.source: Per-test timeout, after which hang dump is triggered and the testhost process is terminated. Default is 1h. The timeout value is specified in the following format: 1.5h / 90m / 5400s / 5400000ms. When no unit is used (e.g. 5400000), the value is assumed to be in milliseconds. When used together with data driven tests, the timeout behavior depends on the test adapter used. For xUnit, NUnit and MSTest 2.2.4+ the timeout is renewed after every test case, For MSTest before 2.2.4, the timeout is used for all testcases.
trans-unit.target: Per-test timeout, after which hang dump is triggered and the testhost process is terminated. Default is 1h. The timeout value is specified in the following format: 1.5h / 90m / 5400s / 5400000ms. When no unit is used (e.g. 5400000), the value is assumed to be in milliseconds. When used together with data driven tests, the timeout behavior depends on the test adapter used. For xUnit, NUnit and MSTest 2.2.4+ the timeout is renewed after every test case, For MSTest before 2.2.4, the timeout is used for all testcases.

trans-unit.source:
Sets the value of an environment variable. Creates the variable if it does not exist, overrides if it does. This argument can be specified multiple times to provide multiple variables.
Examples: -e VARIABLE=abc -e VARIABLE="value with spaces" -e VARIABLE="value;seperated with;semicolons" -e VAR1=abc -e VAR2=def -e VAR3=ghi
trans-unit.target:
Sets the value of an environment variable. Creates the variable if it does not exist, overrides if it does. This argument can be specified multiple times to provide multiple variables.
Examples: -e VARIABLE=abc -e VARIABLE="value with spaces" -e VARIABLE="value;seperated with;semicolons" -e VAR1=abc -e VAR2=def -e VAR3=ghi

trans-unit.source:
Sets the value of an environment variable. Creates the variable if it does not exist, overrides if it does. This will force the tests to be run in an isolated process. This argument can be specified multiple times to provide multiple variables.
Examples: -e VARIABLE=abc -e VARIABLE="value with spaces" -e VARIABLE="value;seperated with;semicolons" -e VAR1=abc -e VAR2=def -e VAR3=ghi
trans-unit.target:
Sets the value of an environment variable. Creates the variable if it does not exist, overrides if it does. This will force the tests to be run in an isolated process. This argument can be specified multiple times to provide multiple variables.

trans-unit.source: List all projects in a solution file.
trans-unit.target: List all projects in a solution file.

trans-unit.source: Display solution folder paths.
trans-unit.target: Display solution folder paths.

trans-unit.source: Shut down the MSBuild build server.
trans-unit.target: Shut down the MSBuild build server.

trans-unit.source: MANIFEST
trans-unit.target: MANIFEST

trans-unit.source: The path to a target manifest file that contains the list of packages to be excluded from the publish step.
trans-unit.target: The path to a target manifest file that contains the list of packages to be excluded from the publish step.

trans-unit.source: Generate a .slnx file from a .sln file.
trans-unit.target: Generate a .slnx file from a .sln file.

trans-unit.source: .NET Add Command
trans-unit.target: .NET Add Command

trans-unit.source: List references or packages of a .NET project.
trans-unit.target: List references or packages of a .NET project.

trans-unit.source: .NET Remove Command
trans-unit.target: .NET Remove Command

trans-unit.source: Do not build the project before publishing. Implies --no-restore.
trans-unit.target: Do not build the project before publishing. Implies --no-restore.

trans-unit.source: Do not build project-to-project references and only build the specified project.
trans-unit.target: Do not build project-to-project references and only build the specified project.

trans-unit.source: Do not use incremental building.
trans-unit.target: Do not use incremental building.

trans-unit.source: Do not restore the project before building.
trans-unit.target: Do not restore the project before building.

trans-unit.source: OS
trans-unit.target: OS

trans-unit.source: The target operating system.
trans-unit.target: The target operating system.

trans-unit.source: Specifies a NuGet source to use.
trans-unit.target: Specifies a NuGet source to use.

trans-unit.source: Filters the templates based on the template author.
trans-unit.target: Filters the templates based on the template author.

trans-unit.source: Filters the templates based on baseline defined in the template.
trans-unit.target: Filters the templates based on baseline defined in the template.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the columns to display in the output.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the columns to display in the output.

trans-unit.source: Displays all columns in the output.
trans-unit.target: Displays all columns in the output.

trans-unit.source: Allows the command to stop and wait for user input or action (for example to complete authentication).
trans-unit.target: Allows the command to stop and wait for user input or action (for example to complete authentication).

trans-unit.source: Filters templates based on language.
trans-unit.target: Filters templates based on language.

trans-unit.source: Location to place the generated output.
trans-unit.target: Location to place the generated output.

trans-unit.source: Filters the templates based on NuGet package ID.
trans-unit.target: Filters the templates based on NuGet package ID.

trans-unit.source: The project that should be used for context evaluation.
trans-unit.target: The project that should be used for context evaluation.

trans-unit.source: Filters the templates based on the tag.
trans-unit.target: Filters the templates based on the tag.

trans-unit.source: Filters templates based on available types. Predefined values are "project" and "item".
trans-unit.target: Filters templates based on available types. Predefined values are "project" and "item".

trans-unit.source: OUTPUT_DIR
trans-unit.target: OUTPUT_DIR

trans-unit.source: .NET Core NuGet Package Packer
trans-unit.target: .NET Core NuGet Package Packer

trans-unit.source: OUTPUT_DIR
trans-unit.target: OUTPUT_DIR

trans-unit.source: The output directory to place built packages in.
trans-unit.target: The output directory to place built packages in.

trans-unit.source: VERSION
trans-unit.target: VERSION

trans-unit.source: The version of the package to create
trans-unit.target: The version of the package to create

trans-unit.source: The configuration to use for building the package. The default is 'Release'.
trans-unit.target: The configuration to use for building the package. The default is 'Release'.

trans-unit.source: Add a NuGet package reference to the project.
trans-unit.target: Add a NuGet package reference to the project.

trans-unit.source: FRAMEWORK
trans-unit.target: FRAMEWORK

trans-unit.source: Add the reference only when targeting a specific framework.
trans-unit.target: Add the reference only when targeting a specific framework.

trans-unit.source: Add the reference without performing restore preview and compatibility check.
trans-unit.target: Add the reference without performing restore preview and compatibility check.

trans-unit.source: SOURCE
trans-unit.target: SOURCE

trans-unit.source: The NuGet package source to use during the restore.
trans-unit.target: The NuGet package source to use during the restore.

trans-unit.source: Package reference in the form of a package identifier like '{0}' or package identifier and version separated by '@' like '{0}@{1}'.
trans-unit.target: Package reference in the form of a package identifier like '{0}' or package identifier and version separated by '@' like '{0}@{1}'.

trans-unit.source: Package reference id and version must not be null.
trans-unit.target: Package reference id and version must not be null.

trans-unit.source: List all package references of the project or solution.
trans-unit.target: List all package references of the project or solution.

trans-unit.source: FRAMEWORK | FRAMEWORK\RID
trans-unit.target: FRAMEWORK | FRAMEWORK\RID

trans-unit.source: Chooses a framework to show its packages. Use the option multiple times for multiple frameworks.
trans-unit.target: Chooses a framework to show its packages. Use the option multiple times for multiple frameworks.

trans-unit.source: SOURCE
trans-unit.target: SOURCE

trans-unit.source: The NuGet sources to use when searching for newer packages. Requires the '--outdated', '--deprecated' or '--vulnerable' option.
trans-unit.target: The NuGet sources to use when searching for newer packages. Requires the '--outdated', '--deprecated' or '--vulnerable' option.

trans-unit.source: Remove a NuGet package reference from the project.
trans-unit.target: Remove a NuGet package reference from the project.

trans-unit.source: The package reference to remove.
trans-unit.target: The package reference to remove.

trans-unit.source: Searches one or more package sources for packages that match a search term. If no sources are specified, all sources defined in the NuGet.Config are used.
trans-unit.target: Searches one or more package sources for packages that match a search term. If no sources are specified, all sources defined in the NuGet.Config are used.

trans-unit.source: Include prerelease packages.
trans-unit.target: Include prerelease packages.

trans-unit.source: SearchTerm
trans-unit.target: SearchTerm

trans-unit.source: Search term to filter package names, descriptions, and tags. Used as a literal value. Example: `dotnet package search some.package`. See also `--exact-match`.
trans-unit.target: Search term to filter package names, descriptions, and tags. Used as a literal value. Example: `dotnet package search some.package`. See also `--exact-match`.

trans-unit.source: Skip
trans-unit.target: Skip

trans-unit.source: Number of results to skip, to allow pagination. Default 0.
trans-unit.target: Number of results to skip, to allow pagination. Default 0.

trans-unit.source: Take
trans-unit.target: Take

trans-unit.source: Number of results to return. Default 20.
trans-unit.target: Number of results to return. Default 20.

trans-unit.source: The project file to operate on. If a file is not specified, the command will search the current directory for one.
trans-unit.target: The project file to operate on. If a file is not specified, the command will search the current directory for one.

trans-unit.source: Convert a file-based program to a project-based program.
trans-unit.target: Convert a file-based program to a project-based program.

trans-unit.source: Determines changes without actually modifying the file system
trans-unit.target: Determines changes without actually modifying the file system

trans-unit.source: PROJECT_MANIFEST
trans-unit.target: PROJECT_MANIFEST

trans-unit.source: The XML file that contains the list of packages to be stored.
trans-unit.target: The XML file that contains the list of packages to be stored.

trans-unit.source: The project file or C# file-based app to operate on. If a file is not specified, the command will search the current directory for a project file.
trans-unit.target: The project file or C# file-based app to operate on. If a file is not specified, the command will search the current directory for a project file.

trans-unit.source: PROJECT | FILE
trans-unit.target: PROJECT | FILE

trans-unit.source: Publisher for the .NET Platform
trans-unit.target: Publisher for the .NET Platform

trans-unit.source: The configuration to publish for. The default is 'Release' for NET 8.0 projects and above, but 'Debug' for older projects.
trans-unit.target: The configuration to publish for. The default is 'Release' for NET 8.0 projects and above, but 'Debug' for older projects.

trans-unit.source: The target framework to publish for. The target framework has to be specified in the project file.
trans-unit.target: The target framework to publish for. The target framework has to be specified in the project file.

trans-unit.source: OUTPUT_DIR
trans-unit.target: OUTPUT_DIR

trans-unit.source: The output directory to place the published artifacts in.
trans-unit.target: The output directory to place the published artifacts in.

trans-unit.source: The target runtime to publish for. This is used when creating a self-contained deployment. The default is to publish a framework-dependent application.
trans-unit.target: The target runtime to publish for. This is used when creating a self-contained deployment. The default is to publish a framework-dependent application.

trans-unit.source: Shut down the Razor build server.
trans-unit.target: Shut down the Razor build server.

trans-unit.source: Add a project-to-project reference to the project.
trans-unit.target: Add a project-to-project reference to the project.

trans-unit.source: Add the reference only when targeting a specific framework.
trans-unit.target: Add the reference only when targeting a specific framework.

trans-unit.source: The paths to the projects to add as references.
trans-unit.target: The paths to the projects to add as references.

trans-unit.source: PROJECT_PATH
trans-unit.target: PROJECT_PATH

trans-unit.source: List all project-to-project references of the project.
trans-unit.target: List all project-to-project references of the project.

trans-unit.source: Remove a project-to-project reference from the project.
trans-unit.target: Remove a project-to-project reference from the project.

trans-unit.source: Remove the reference only when targeting a specific framework.
trans-unit.target: Remove the reference only when targeting a specific framework.

trans-unit.source: The paths to the referenced projects to remove.
trans-unit.target: The paths to the referenced projects to remove.

trans-unit.source: PROJECT_PATH
trans-unit.target: PROJECT_PATH

trans-unit.source: Remove one or more projects from a solution file.
trans-unit.target: Remove one or more projects from a solution file.

trans-unit.source: The project paths or names to remove from the solution.
trans-unit.target: The project paths or names to remove from the solution.

trans-unit.source: PROJECT_PATH
trans-unit.target: PROJECT_PATH

trans-unit.source: .NET dependency restorer
trans-unit.target: .NET dependency restorer

trans-unit.source: .NET Run Command
trans-unit.target: .NET Run Command

trans-unit.source: The configuration to run for. The default for most projects is 'Debug'.
trans-unit.target: The configuration to run for. The default for most projects is 'Debug'.

trans-unit.source: The target framework to run for. The target framework must also be specified in the project file.
trans-unit.target: The target framework to run for. The target framework must also be specified in the project file.

trans-unit.source: The target runtime to run for.
trans-unit.target: The target runtime to run for.

trans-unit.source: RUNTIME_IDENTIFIER
trans-unit.target: RUNTIME_IDENTIFIER

trans-unit.source: .NET SDK Command
trans-unit.target: .NET SDK Command

trans-unit.source: .NET SDK Check Command
trans-unit.target: .NET SDK Check Command

trans-unit.source: The '--self-contained' and '--no-self-contained' options cannot be used together.
trans-unit.target: The '--self-contained' and '--no-self-contained' options cannot be used together.

trans-unit.source: Publish the .NET runtime with your application so the runtime doesn't need to be installed on the target machine. The default is 'false.' However, when targeting .NET 7 or lower, the default is 'true' if a runtime identifier is specified.
trans-unit.target: Publish the .NET runtime with your application so the runtime doesn't need to be installed on the target machine. The default is 'false.' However, when targeting .NET 7 or lower, the default is 'true' if a runtime identifier is specified.

trans-unit.source: Skip the optimization phase.
trans-unit.target: Skip the optimization phase.

trans-unit.source: Skip creating symbol files which can be used for profiling the optimized assemblies.
trans-unit.target: Skip creating symbol files which can be used for profiling the optimized assemblies.

trans-unit.source: Recursively add projects' ReferencedProjects to solution
trans-unit.target: Recursively add projects' ReferencedProjects to solution

trans-unit.source: .NET modify solution file command
trans-unit.target: .NET modify solution file command

trans-unit.source: The solution file to operate on. If not specified, the command will search the current directory for one.
trans-unit.target: The solution file to operate on. If not specified, the command will search the current directory for one.

trans-unit.source: SLN_FILE
trans-unit.target: SLN_FILE

trans-unit.source: The project or solution file to operate on. If a file is not specified, the command will search the current directory for one.
trans-unit.target: The project or solution file to operate on. If a file is not specified, the command will search the current directory for one.

trans-unit.source: PROJECT | SOLUTION
trans-unit.target: PROJECT | SOLUTION

trans-unit.source: The project or solution or C# (file-based program) file to operate on. If a file is not specified, the command will search the current directory for a project or solution.
trans-unit.target: The project or solution or C# (file-based program) file to operate on. If a file is not specified, the command will search the current directory for a project or solution.

trans-unit.source: PROJECT | SOLUTION | FILE
trans-unit.target: PROJECT | SOLUTION | FILE

trans-unit.source: Source
trans-unit.target: Source

trans-unit.source: The package source to search. You can pass multiple `--source` options to search multiple package sources. Example: `--source https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json`.
trans-unit.target: The package source to search. You can pass multiple `--source` options to search multiple package sources. Example: `--source https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json`.

trans-unit.source: Stores the specified assemblies for the .NET Platform. By default, these will be optimized for the target runtime and framework.
trans-unit.target: Stores the specified assemblies for the .NET Platform. By default, these will be optimized for the target runtime and framework.

trans-unit.source: The target framework to store packages for. The target framework has to be specified in the project file.
trans-unit.target: The target framework to store packages for. The target framework has to be specified in the project file.

trans-unit.source: OUTPUT_DIR
trans-unit.target: OUTPUT_DIR

trans-unit.source: The output directory to store the given assemblies in.
trans-unit.target: The output directory to store the given assemblies in.

trans-unit.source: The target runtime to store packages for.
trans-unit.target: The target runtime to store packages for.

trans-unit.source: Displays a summary of what would happen if the given command line were run if it would result in a template creation.
trans-unit.target: Displays a summary of what would happen if the given command line were run if it would result in a template creation.

trans-unit.source: Forces content to be generated even if it would change existing files.
trans-unit.target: Forces content to be generated even if it would change existing files.

trans-unit.source: The name for the output being created. If no name is specified, the name of the output directory is used.
trans-unit.target: The name for the output being created. If no name is specified, the name of the output directory is used.

trans-unit.source: Disables checking for the template package updates when instantiating a template.
trans-unit.target: Disables checking for the template package updates when instantiating a template.

trans-unit.source: Run test(s), without displaying Microsoft Testplatform banner
trans-unit.target: Run test(s), without displaying Microsoft Testplatform banner

trans-unit.source: OUTPUT_DIR
trans-unit.target: OUTPUT_DIR

trans-unit.source: The configuration to use for running tests. The default for most projects is 'Debug'.
trans-unit.target: The configuration to use for running tests. The default for most projects is 'Debug'.

trans-unit.source: The target framework to run tests for. The target framework must also be specified in the project file.
trans-unit.target: The target framework to run tests for. The target framework must also be specified in the project file.

trans-unit.source: The target runtime to test for.
trans-unit.target: The target runtime to test for.

trans-unit.source: Executes a tool from source without permanently installing it.
trans-unit.target: Executes a tool from source without permanently installing it.

trans-unit.source: Shut down the VB/C# compiler build server.
trans-unit.target: Shut down the VB/C# compiler build server.

trans-unit.source: Cannot specify --version when the package argument already contains a version.
trans-unit.target: Cannot specify --version when the package argument already contains a version.

trans-unit.source: Verbosity
trans-unit.target: Verbosity

trans-unit.source: Display this amount of details in the output: `normal`, `minimal`, `detailed`. The default is `normal`
trans-unit.target: Display this amount of details in the output: `normal`, `minimal`, `detailed`. The default is `normal`

trans-unit.source: Set the MSBuild verbosity level. Allowed values are q[uiet], m[inimal], n[ormal], d[etailed], and diag[nostic].
trans-unit.target: Set the MSBuild verbosity level. Allowed values are q[uiet], m[inimal], n[ormal], d[etailed], and diag[nostic].

trans-unit.source: VERSION_SUFFIX
trans-unit.target: VERSION_SUFFIX

trans-unit.source: Accept all confirmation prompts using "yes."
trans-unit.target: Accept all confirmation prompts using "yes."

trans-unit.source: The friendly name of the data collector to use for the test run. More info here: https://aka.ms/vstest-collect
trans-unit.target: The friendly name of the data collector to use for the test run. More info here: https://aka.ms/vstest-collect

trans-unit.source: DATA_COLLECTOR_NAME
trans-unit.target: DATA_COLLECTOR_NAME
